alert.note: Alert for Burnet; Travis; Williamson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 7:29PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Williamson, northwestern Travis and central Burnet Counties through 815 PM CDT... At 728 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northwest of Lake Victor, or 11 miles southwest of Lampasas, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Burnet, Marble Falls, Bertram, Leander, Liberty Hill, Lake Victor, Sunnylane, Joppa, Smithwick, Oatmeal, Shady Grove and Jonestown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for south central Texas.
